parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To weight, load, burden, lit. and met. From barus; to weigh down.
From huperballo; a throwing beyond others, i.e. supereminence; adverbially pre- eminently.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To be utterly without resource, be in despair. Middle voice from ek and aporeo; to be utterly at a loss, i.e. Despond.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
